item.title: Here are the 55 US AI startups that raised $100M or more in 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Last year was monumental for the AI industry in the U.S. and beyond. How will 2025 compare?

item.title: Well, there goes the metaverse!
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The metaverse is on its last legs as VR is eclipsed by AI. But that's not the only thing that went wrong for Meta's VR ambitions.

item.title: Rogue agents and shadow AI: Why VCs are betting big on AI security
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Misaligned agents are just one layer of the AI security challenge that startup Witness AI is trying to solve. It detects employee use of unapproved tools, blocking attacks, and ensuring compliance.

item.title: Looking ahead to 2026: What’s next for Startup Battlefield 200
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: See what to expect for Startup Battlefield 200 in 2026, the ultimate startup pitch competition on the global stage at TechCrunch Disrupt. Join the mailing list to be the first to know when applications drop.

item.title: BioticsAI, which won Disrupt’s Battlefield competition in 2023, gains FDA approval for its AI-powered fetal ultrasound product
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: TechCrunch Disrupt Battlefield 2023 winner, BioticsAI, announced on Monday that it has received FDA clearance for its AI software that helps detect fetal abnormalities in ultrasound images.

item.title: Sequoia to invest in Anthropic, breaking VC taboo on backing rivals: FT
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Sequoia Capital is reportedly joining a blockbuster funding round for Anthropic, the AI startup behind Claude, according to the Financial Times. It’s a move sure to turn heads in Silicon Valley. Why? Because venture capital firms have historically avoided backing competing companies in the same sector, preferring to place their bets on a single winner. […]

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: ‘Physical AI’ enters the hype machine
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility, your hub for all things “future of transportation.”

item.title: Threads edges out X in daily mobile users, new data shows
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Threads’ daily mobile usage has quietly surpassed X as Meta leans on cross-promotion, creator tools and fast feature rollouts — even as X faces fresh controversies

item.title: How YC-backed Bucket Robotics survived its first CES
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Now, the startup is turning its attention to building the business, fundraising and striking commercial deals.

item.title: Moxie Marlinspike has a privacy-conscious alternative to ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Confer is designed to look and feel like ChatGPT or Claude, but your conversations can't be used for training or advertising.

item.title: Why Silicon Valley is really talking about fleeing California (it’s not the 5%)
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: As highlighted Friday in the New York Post, the proposed wealth tax would hit founders on their voting shares rather than the actual equity they own.

item.title: Who gets to inherit the stars? A space ethicist on what we’re not talking about
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: While it's easy to romanticize space as an escape to a pristine frontier where people will float weightlessly among the stars, it’s worth remembering there are no oceans or mountains or chirpy birds in space. It's “not nice up there,” said Rubenstein. “It is not nice at all."

item.title: Trump administration’s legal setbacks are good news for offshore wind — and the grid
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Three offshore wind projects under construction on the U.S. East Coast are back to building after judges rebuked the Department of the Interior's actions.

item.title: Oshen built the first ocean robot to collect data in a Category 5 hurricane
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Oshen has signed contracts with multiple government agencies for its C-Star robots to collect ocean data autonomously.

item.title: Musk wants up to $134B in OpenAI lawsuit, despite $700B fortune
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Musk's legal team argues he should be compensated as an early startup investor who sees returns "many orders of magnitude greater" than his initial investment.

item.title: AI cloud startup Runpod hits $120M in ARR — and it started with a Reddit post
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Their startup journey is a wild example of how if you build it well and the timing is lucky, they will definitely come.

item.title: California AG sends Musk’s xAI a cease-and-desist order over sexual deepfakes
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The flood of AI-generated sexual imagery has spurred concern from state and congressional officials alike.

item.title: Snowflake, Databricks challenger ClickHouse hits $15B valuation
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The $400 million round was led by Dragoneer.

item.title: TikTok quietly launches a microdrama app called ‘PineDrama’
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Think TikTok, but every single video you come across is a short episode of a fictional story.

item.title: EPA rules that xAI’s natural gas generators were illegally used
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Elon Musk's AI company had installed and operated 35 natural gas turbines without permits, something the EPA now says was illegal.
